required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ASCEND: A Study of Cardiovascular Events iN Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Cardiovascular Events iN Diabetes - A Randomized 2x2 Factorial Study of Aspirin Versus Placebo, and of Omega-3 Fatty Acid Supplementation Versus Placebo, for Primary Prevention of Cardiovascular Events in People With Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether 100mg daily aspirin versus placebo and/or supplementation with 1 gram daily omega-3 fatty acids or placebo prevents "serious vascular events" (i.e. non-fatal heart attack, non-fatal stroke or transient ischaemic attack, or death from vascular causes) in patients with diabetes who are not known to have occlusive arterial disease and to assess the effects on serious bleeding or other adverse events.

detailed_description.textblock:
The role of antiplatelet therapy (chiefly aspirin) for the secondary prevention of heart attacks and strokes is firmly established for many high-risk people with diagnosed arterial disease, and the proportional reductions in these cardiovascular events appear to be about one quarter, whether or not such patients have diabetes. But, most younger and middle-aged people with diabetes do not have manifest arterial disease - although they are still at significant cardiovascular risk - and yet few trials have tested aspirin in such individuals. As a result, there is substantial uncertainty about the role of aspirin for the prevention of heart attacks and strokes among apparently healthy people with diabetes, and only a small minority receives it.
There is consistent evidence from observational studies of lower rates of cardiovascular disease (particularly cardiac and sudden death) in people with higher intakes, or higher blood levels, of fish oils (omega-3 fatty acids). Trials in people who have survived a heart attack have shown modest, but potentially worthwhile, reductions in coronary events. There have been, however, no large-scale trials of the use of fish oils for the prevention of vascular events in people without diagnosed arterial disease.
If ASCEND can reliably demonstrate that aspirin and/or fish oils safely reduce the risk of cardiovascular events and deaths in people with diabetes who do not have pre-existing arterial disease, then this would be relevant to some tens of millions of people world-wide (who are currently not receiving such therapy) and might save tens of thousands of lives each year.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Occurrence of Any Serious Vascular Event (SVE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy assessments involve intention-to-treat comparisons among all randomized participants of allocation to aspirin versus placebo and, separately, of omega-3 fatty acids versus placebo on the first occurrence of any "Serious Vascular Event" (SVE), defined as: non-fatal myocardial infarction; or non-fatal stroke (excluding confirmed intracranial hemorrhage) or TIA; or vascular death excluding confirmed intracranial hemorrhage (defined as International Classification of Diseases 10th revision [ICD-10] I00-52 or I63-99, i.e. excluding subarachnoid hemorrhage [I60], intracerebral hemorrhage [I61], and other non-traumatic intracranial hemorrhage [I62]).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Occurrence of Any Major Bleed (Aspirin Comparison Only)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
primary_outcome.description: The primary safety assessments involve intention-to-treat comparisons among all randomized patients of allocation to aspirin versus placebo on the first occurrence of "any major bleed", defined as: any confirmed intracranial hemorrhage (including intracerebral, subarachnoid, subdural or any other intracranial hemorrhage); or sight-threatening eye bleeding; or any other serious bleeding episode.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Combined End-point of Serious Vascular Events (SVEs) or Revascularizations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary efficacy assessments involve intention-to-treat comparisons among all randomized participants of allocation to aspirin versus placebo and, separately, of omega-3 versus placebo on the first occurrence of the expanded vascular endpoint of "SVE or revascularization" (including coronary and non-coronary revascularizations).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Incident Gastrointestinal (GI) Tract Cancer (Aspirin Comparison Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary efficacy assessments of aspirin involve intention-to-treat comparisons during the scheduled treatment period among all randomized participants on the first occurrence of: Any incident gastrointestinal (GI) tract cancer (i.e. any GI cancer excluding pancreas and hepatobiliary), overall and after exclusion of the first three years of follow-up.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: All-cause Mortality
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: 'All-cause mortality' includes all recorded deaths.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Coronary
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'Coronary' events include deaths from: Acute MI and other CHD (unspecified Acute ischaemic heart disease; Atherosclerotic heart disease; Ischaemic cardiomyopathy; unspecified Chronic ischaemic heart disease).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: All Stroke
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'All stroke' events include deaths from: Haemorrhagic stroke (Intracerebral haemorrhage; Subarachnoid haemorrhage); Non-haemorrhagic stroke (Cerebral infarction; Stroke not specified as haemorrhage or infarction).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Other Vascular
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'Other vascular' events include deaths from: Heart failure (excluding ischaemic cardiomyopathy); Other vascular death (excluding stroke; and Cardiac death (excluding CHD).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'Cancer' events include any death attributed to cancer.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Respiratory
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'Respiratory' events include any death attributed to respiratory causes.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Other Medical
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'Other medical' events include deaths from: Non-vascular medical causes (excluding cancer and respiratory, including Fatal GI bleed or perforation); and deaths from Renal disease and Diabetes.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: External Cause
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Fatal 'External cause' events include deaths from: Injury; Fracture; Self harm; and Medical and surgical complications

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Unknown Cause
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Any death for which the cause is not known.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Any Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Incidence of fatal or non-fatal cancers. Any cancer excludes non-fatal non-melanoma skin cancer and non-fatal recurrence of a cancer that had occurred before randomization. A single participant may have had multiple cancers.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Other Gastrointestinal Cancer (Aspirin Comparison Only)
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers. Excludes cancers reported in the gastrointestinal tract category (see secondary outcome measure #4), and includes hepatobiliary and pancreatic cancers.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Respiratory Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers. Includes lung and larynx cancer.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Genitourinary Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal renal, bladder, prostate, gynaecological and other GU cancers

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Hematological Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers. Includes leukaemia and lymphoma.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Breast Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Melanoma
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal melanomas.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Other Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers not included elsewhere (where the type of cancer is known).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Unspecified Cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers of unknown type.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Atrial Fibrillation (Omega-3 Comparison Only)
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal events.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Event: Other Arrhythmia (Omega-3 Comparison Only)
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
other_outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal events, excludes atrial fibrillation.

arm_group.description: Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.
Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.
Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
arm_group.description: Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
Placebo Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3 Ethyl Esters

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females with type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus.
- Aged ≥ 40 years.
- No previous history of vascular disease.
- No clear contra-indication to aspirin.
- No other predominant life-threatening medical problem.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Definite history of myocardial infarction, stroke or arterial revascularisation procedure.
- Currently prescribed aspirin, warfarin or any other blood thinning medication.

overall_official.last_name: Jane M Armitage, BSc, MBBS, MRCP, FFPH
overall_official.affiliation: Clinical Trial Service Unit, University of Oxford

facility.name: Clinical Trial Service Unit, University of Oxford

link.description: Click here for more information about ASCEND : A Study of Cardiovascular Events iN Diabetes
Effects of Aspirin for Primary Prevention in Persons with Diabetes Mellitus (NEJM)
Effects of n−3 Fatty Acid Supplements in Diabetes Mellitus (NEJM)

patient_data.ipd_description: Proposals for substudies must be approved by the Steering Committee. Procedures for accessing the data for this study are available on: https://www.ndph.ox.ac.uk/about/data-access-policy.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Informed Consent Form

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were randomized between June 2005 through July 2011. Follow-up continued until March 2018.

group.title: Aspirin + Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
group.description: Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily. Aspirin Omega-3 ethyl esters

group.title: Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
group.description: Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily. Aspirin Placebo omega-3 ethyl esters

group.title: Placebo Aspirin + Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
group.description: Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily. Placebo aspirin Omega-3 ethyl esters

group.title: Placebo Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3 Ethyl Esters
group.description: Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily. Placebo aspirin Placebo omega-3 ethyl esters

group.title: Aspirin + Omega-3
group.description: Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

group.title: Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3
group.description: Participants receive 100mg of aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

group.title: Placebo Aspirin + Omega-3
group.description: Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and 1g of omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

group.title: Placebo Aspirin + Placebo Omega-3
group.description: Participants receive placebo aspirin once daily and placebo omega-3 ethyl esters once daily.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Body-mass index (kg/m²)
measure.description: The body-mass index (the weight in kilograms divided by the square of the height in meters) was based on values for weight and height that were reported by the participants.

measure.title: Body-mass index (mean)
Smoking status
Treated hypertension
measure.description: Participant reported hypertension

measure.title: Aspirin use prior to screening
Type of diabetes
measure.description: The presence of type 2 diabetes was based on a broad clinical definition involving the age of the participant at the diagnosis of diabetes, the use of insulin within 1-year after diagnosis, and the body-mass index.

measure.title: Duration of diabetes (years)
Duration of diabetes (years)
Systolic blood pressure (mmHg)
Systolic blood pressure (mean)
Vascular risk score
measure.description: We categorized the predicted 5-year risk of serious vascular event (including transient ischemic attack) without the use of aspirin or n-3 fatty acids as follows: low risk as less than 5%, moderate risk as 5% to less than 10%, and high risk as 10% or more.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With First Occurrence of Any Serious Vascular Event (SVE)
outcome.description: The primary efficacy assessments involve intention-to-treat comparisons among all randomized participants of allocation to aspirin versus placebo and, separately, of omega-3 fatty acids versus placebo on the first occurrence of any "Serious Vascular Event" (SVE), defined as: non-fatal myocardial infarction; or non-fatal stroke (excluding confirmed intracranial hemorrhage) or TIA; or vascular death excluding confirmed intracranial hemorrhage (defined as International Classification of Diseases 10th revision [ICD-10] I00-52 or I63-99, i.e. excluding subarachnoid hemorrhage [I60], intracerebral hemorrhage [I61], and other non-traumatic intracranial hemorrhage [I62]).
outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Unknown Cause
outcome.description: Any death for which the cause is not known.
outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years

group.title: Aspirin
group.description: Group includes 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Omega-3 arm, and 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Placebo Omega-3 arm

measure.title: Number of Participants With Fatal Event: Unknown Cause
measure.description: Any death for which the cause is not known.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Event: Any Cancer
outcome.description: Incidence of fatal or non-fatal cancers. Any cancer excludes non-fatal non-melanoma skin cancer and non-fatal recurrence of a cancer that had occurred before randomization. A single participant may have had multiple cancers.
outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years

group.title: Aspirin
group.description: Group includes 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Omega-3 arm, and 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Placebo Omega-3 arm

measure.title: Number of Participants With Event: Any Cancer
measure.description: Incidence of fatal or non-fatal cancers. Any cancer excludes non-fatal non-melanoma skin cancer and non-fatal recurrence of a cancer that had occurred before randomization. A single participant may have had multiple cancers.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Event: Other Gastrointestinal Cancer (Aspirin Comparison Only)
outcome.description: Includes fatal and non-fatal cancers. Excludes cancers reported in the gastrointestinal tract category (see secondary outcome measure #4), and includes hepatobiliary and pancreatic cancers.
outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years

group.title: Aspirin
group.description: Group includes 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Omega-3 arm, and 3870 participants in the Aspirin+Placebo Omega-3 arm

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Event: Respiratory Cancer

outcome.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years

reported_events.time_frame: Randomized treatment phase during a mean of 7.4 years
reported_events.desc: Follow-up questionnaires asking about cardiovascular events and other Serious Adverse Events were sent to participants at 6-monthly intervals. Only information about Serious Adverse Events were collected, therefore there are no Non-Serious Adverse Events to report.

group.title: Aspirin

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
